meanings.definition: To exceed in range or extent.
meanings.sent1: The cheetah was outranging all the other animals in the savannah.
meanings.sent2: The airplane was outranging the distance it had ever flown before.
meanings.sent3: The tortoise challenged the hare to a race, outranging everyone's expectations.
meanings.sent4: Her voice soared, outranging the highest notes of the opera singer.
meanings.sent5: The rocket shot into the sky, outranging any previous launch.

meanings.definition: To go beyond the limits of.
meanings.sent1: The floodwaters were outranging the levees, causing widespread damage.
meanings.sent2: His ambition was outranging what anyone thought possible for a small-town boy.
meanings.sent3: The little seedling was outranging its tiny pot, yearning for more space.
meanings.sent4: His generosity was outranging his bank account, always willing to help others.
meanings.sent5: The wildfire was outranging the efforts of the firefighters, spreading rapidly.
